thread.title: Lake Taylor thumps Churchland, but QB injures shoulder
thread.title_full: Lake Taylor thumps Churchland, but QB injures shoulder | HamptonRoads.com | PilotOnline.com

author: Mike Connors
title: Lake Taylor thumps Churchland, but QB injures shoulder
text:
NORFOLK Lake Taylor cruised to an easy win Friday night, while dealing with a potentially harmful loss.
Quarterback Tyrek Hughey ran for two touchdowns and threw for another, but left in the second quarter with a shoulder injury in the Titans' 48-6 win over visiting Churchland.
Titans coach Hank Sawyer said Hughey sustained strained ligaments in his right shoulder.
Lake Taylor (6-0) displayed a dominant rushing game before Hughey's injury and took it to a higher gear after his departure.
Dazmine Palmer rushed for 215 yards and a touchdown, while Deon Smith added 118 yards and two touchdowns for the Titans, who finished with 43 carries for 344 yards.
"He's constantly moving his feet," offensive lineman Mike Carney said of Palmer. "And has a big heart."
Churchland (2-4) was playing its second game in four days, after falling to Booker T. Washington on Tuesday, and couldn't muster much offense early.
The Truckers' Jamil Edwards gained 55 yards on his first carry.
Other than that, Churchland totaled minus-18 yards in the first half. Lake Taylor led 28-0 at the intermission.
Lake Taylor's defense also provided scoring. Roman Bond scooped up a fumble late in the first quarter and ran it in 7 yards for a touchdown.
"We are going to hang our hats on defense," Sawyer said. "If they can't score, they can't beat you."
Lake Taylor wore pink numbers and its coaches wore pink shirts to recognize breast cancer awareness month. Sawyer said his sister, Kim Jones, died of the disease on Mother's Day. She was 53.
Senior cornerback/wide receiver Wayne Davis said the team promised before the game to make a statement in honor of Jones.
"That's what we did," Davis said.
